item.description: This page describes my experiences with the static web site publishing tool Hugo. Open link in new tab There is a discussion which describes How to open links in a new tab.

item.title: Serving static pages locally
item.description: Running build-in tomcat server It is possible to deploy Jekyll sites locally, because OSX has a build-in Apache tomcat server. The local sites reside under ~/Sites.

item.title: Mermaid
item.description: Mermaid is a JavaScript based diagramming and charting tool that renders Markdown-inspired text definitions to create and modify diagrams dynamically.

item.title: How to work with modules and packages in Go
item.description: I had to practice a long time to understand the go concepts of modules, packages, and how to publish them to github.

item.title: Bolero hosting Razor page
item.description: In this post we investigate how to use Razor pages on the host and Bolero WebAssembly on the client side. The final code can be found on My github - Tutorials - BoleroAppRazor.

item.title: General production optimization
item.description: Optimization General production structure capacited multi-level lot-sizing model PochetWolsey, page 45 $1 \le i \le m$: set of items to be produced $1 \le k \le K$: set of shared resources with limited capacity $1 \le t \le n$: time periods until final period n $p_t$: unit production cost $q_t$: fixed production cost $h_t$: unit inventory cost $d_t^i$: demand for item i to be satisified at period t $M_t$: large positive number, expressing an upper bound on the maximum lot size iin period t $L_t^k$: available capacity of resource k during period t $\alpha^{i k}, \beta^{i k}$: amount of capacity of resource k consumed $1 \le j \le m$: items $D(i)$ set of direct successors of part i in the BOM, i.

item.title: Mixed integer linear optimiziation for supply chain and production
item.description: This blog contains formulas which can be used to optimize the supply chain with multiple suppliers, and a general production planning formula, taken from the book POCHET, Yves und WOLSEY, Laurence A.

item.title: Github resources
item.description: Some of my codes are documented on my Github with description in the readme files. Take a look there. Github Description BoleroApp A simple Bolero app with file upload and data repository using dependency injection StringAlgorithms Some string algorithms in F# to measure string similarity WebAPI A net7.

item.title: Go tricks & tips
item.description: In 2023, I became interested in the programming language Go. It is a C derivates without all the nil pointer exceptions, and has a very solid infrastructure and libraries to compile across different operating systems.

item.title: SWIG - interface for C and C++
item.description: SWIG SWIG is a software development tool that connects programs written in C and C++ with a variety of high-level programming languages.

item.title: Operation research
item.description: Operation Research is defined in Wikipedia as Operations research (British English: operational research) … , often shortened to the initialism OR, is a discipline that deals with the development and application of analytical methods to improve decision-making.

item.title: Input file element with Bolero
item.description: Bolero is a set of free and open-source libraries and tools to write web applications in F#. With it, you can write fully dynamic client-side web applications from the comfort of a strongly-typed functional language, all with great performance.

item.title: Using local NuGet source / repository
item.description: Had some problems creating a local nuget repository. This is how I succeeded: Create a local nuget repository / source $ cli nuget add source ~/.

item.title: Bibliographies, citations and dotnet programming
item.description: Helping out a friend to get a Matura thesis completed, I stumbled onto the topics of citations and bibliographies. In the end, I wanted to get a handle on bibliographies using dotnet code.

item.title: Static templating with handlebars, liquid and others
item.description: Templating is an proofen method to create static web pages. Typically, you write your html pages and fill in some parameters at page assembly time.

item.title: Bolero Hints
item.description: This blog contains some experiences working with Bolero. Bolero is a set of free and open-source libraries and tools to write web applications in F#.

item.description: This post covers some more Jekyll tips and tricks like searching a web page. Searching a Jekyll page Web pages based on databases such as WordPress search the data in the underlying database.

item.title: Math formulas and static web site generators
item.description: Mathematical formulas While working on post Mathe Uffzig, I stumbled upon the problem of displaying mathematical formulas in the Jekyll markdown templating engine Liquid.

item.title: WebSharper simple inputs
item.description: This post shows various ways to handle input using WebSharper. Client side There are two basic approaches: using HTML templates or using Websharper’s HTML.

item.title: Websharper OSX
item.description: Installing WebSharper I’m developing web applications using WebSharper on macOS Monterey. To install the the templates, use: % dotnet new -i WebSharper.

item.title: WebSharper templates
item.description: WebSharper allows several ways to instatiate HTML, and It took me some thinking to get these terms right: ws-replace ws-hole ws-template ws-template-children Replace Replace the given node with the provided string or list of docs.

item.title: WebSharper shopping cart
item.description: Websharper Shopping cart I found an interesting article from 2020 by Adam Granizc on the implementation of a WebSharper shopping cart in WebSharper Shopping Cart

item.title: Using Jekyll
item.description: You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes.

item.title: About me
item.description: A Swiss nick name for Markus is Küse, and since I love alliterations, this blog is called Küse’s Code. It contains a collection of code snippets, and demonstrates my various interest, starting with functional programming in F# and Go, and web programming in WebSharper or Bolero, and Elm.

Install phpmyadmin with brew ==> Pouring phpmyadmin--5.2.1.sonoma.bottle.tar.gz ==> Caveats To enable phpMyAdmin in Apache, add the following to httpd.conf and restart Apache: Alias /phpmyadmin /usr/local/share/phpmyadmin <Directory /usr/local/share/phpmyadmin/> Options Indexes FollowSymLinks MultiViews AllowOverride All <IfModule mod_authz_core.

EDI middleware Comparisons https://www.g2.com/categories/electronic-data-interchange-edi https://michaelachrisco.github.io/Electronic-Interchange-Github-Resources/ https://datainterchange.com/edifacts-standards-explained/ Antlr An Antlr implementation: https://github.com/aaronhuggins/js-edi/tree/main/grammars/fact // Special token for discovering the position of control characters for a given EDI document.
